issues.description: Return type mismatch for PersonService.getAllPersons: the problem statement and the template expect/getAllPersons to return a List<Person> (the GET /persons endpoint returns a list of persons), but the solution implementation declares getAllPersons to return Stream<Person> and contains inconsistent local variable names (sortedStream / sortedList). This mismatch breaks the intended API contract and is likely to confuse students: the template and exercises instruct students to implement/consume a List, while the solution uses a different return type and broken implementation, preventing straightforward comparison and causing compilation/runtime surprises.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the solution's PersonService.getAllPersons method match the template/problem contract by returning List<Person> and implementing sorting on a List. For example: change the signature to public List<Person> getAllPersons(PersonSortingOptions sortingOptions) { List<Person> result = new ArrayList<>(this.persons); // apply Comparator based on sortingOptions.getSortField() and sortingOptions.getSortingOrder() Collections.sort(result, comparator); return Collections.unmodifiableList(result); } This aligns the solution with the template and the problem statement and removes the Stream/variable-name inconsistencies.
